Overview Package Class Index No Frames Frames Prev Next

Summary: FUNCTION
fgl

fglcdvMedia

Genero 4GL wrapper around the Cordova Media plugin. The github url of the plugin is https://github.com/FourjsGenero/cordova-plugin-media.git

FUNCTION Summary
create(soundId STRING, filename STRING)
Registers a fileName for a soundId to be used in several calls. For the most applications its sufficient to create exactly one soundId. Only if multiple audio sources need to be played simultaneously, multiple soundId's are needed.
getCurrentAmplitudeAudio(soundId STRING) RETURNING FLOAT
Returns the Audio Meter level when recording.
getCurrentPositionAudio(soundId STRING) RETURNING FLOAT
Does only work while playing a sound file, not while recording.
getDurationAudio(soundId STRING) RETURNING FLOAT
Returns the duration for a media id, this works only if the file exists and is playable
getDurationFromStatus(mediaStatus util.JSONObject) RETURNING FLOAT
Returns the duration when the status message type is MEDIA_DURATION.
getErrorFromStatus(mediaStatus util.JSONObject) RETURNING INT,STRING
Returns the error code and error message when the status message type is MEDIA_ERROR.
getMediaIdFromStatus(mediaStatus util.JSONObject) RETURNING STRING
Returns the mediaId causing the status event
getMessageTypeFromStatus(mediaStatus util.JSONObject) RETURNING INT
Returns a message type out of the given mediaStatus
getNextStatus() RETURNING util.JSONObject
Returns the next queued status object and removes it from the internal queue. This object must be passed to the xxFromStatus functions
getPositionFromStatus(mediaStatus util.JSONObject) RETURNING FLOAT
Returns the media position out of the given mediaStatus when the status message type is MEDIA_POSITION.
getRecordingExtensions() RETURNING DYNAMIC ARRAY OF STRING
Returns an array containing valid file extensions for recording
getStateFromStatus(mediaStatus util.JSONObject) RETURNING INT
Returns the media state when the status message type is MEDIA_STATE.
getStatusCount() RETURNING INT
Returns how many status objects have been queued
handleCallback()
Handles *all* media events in response to an ON ACTION cordovacallback and queues media status messages internally. Those status messages can be fetched with getNextStatus()
init()
inits the plugin must be called prior other calls
isValidRecordingExtension(extension STRING) RETURNING BOOLEAN
Returns if a a give file extension is a valid extension for recording
mediaState2String(state INTEGER) RETURNING STRING
Returns a string description for a media state.
messageType2String(messageType INTEGER) RETURNING STRING
Returns a string description for a messageType
pausePlayingAudio(soundId STRING)
Pauses playing audio. Causes a cordovacallback about state change. Resume playing with startPlayingAudio (in opposite to resumeRecordingAudio).
pauseRecordingAudio(soundId STRING)
Pauses recording. Resume recording with resumeRecordingAudio(). Causes a cordovacallback about state change.
release(soundId STRING)
releases resources associated with a soundId (filename,players,internal recording buffers)
resumeRecordingAudio(soundId STRING)
Resumes recording. Causes a cordovacallback about state change.
seekToAudio(soundId STRING, position INTEGER)
Seeks to a position in the audio stream. Only available for playback. May causes a cordovacallback about state change.
setRate(soundId STRING, rate FLOAT)
Sets the playback rate: only available in IOS.
setVolume(soundId STRING, volume FLOAT)
Sets the audio volume.
startPlayingAudio(soundId STRING, playOptions RECORD)
starts playing a sound file if the playback is over, a cordovacallback is triggered the file for playback must have been registered with the create call it must exist and can have several extensions depending on the platform
startRecordingAudio(soundId STRING)
Starts recording to file. Possible extensions on IOS: .wav and .mp4 , on Android: .mp3 and .aac . The recording file name was specified using the create() call. In case it exists it will be overwritten. The directory for the file must exist. Causes a cordovacallback about state change.
stopPlayingAudio(soundId STRING)
Stops playing audio. Causes a cordovacallback about state change.
stopRecordingAudio(soundId STRING)
Stops recording. Causes a cordovacallback about state change.

Functions

create

FUNCTION create(soundId STRING, filename STRING)

Registers a fileName for a soundId to be used in several calls. For the most applications its sufficient to create exactly one soundId. Only if multiple audio sources need to be played simultaneously, multiple soundId's are needed.

Parameters:
soundId - to be used in startXXAudio, stopXXAudio etc
filename - file for playing or recording one and the same soundId can be used for recording and playing if recording and playing is done exclusively the parameter can also be an http(s) URL for playing

getCurrentAmplitudeAudio

FUNCTION getCurrentAmplitudeAudio(soundId STRING) RETURNING FLOAT

Returns the Audio Meter level when recording.

Parameters:
soundId - id used to start the recording
Returns:
a normalized value between 0.0 and 1.0

getCurrentPositionAudio

FUNCTION getCurrentPositionAudio(soundId STRING) RETURNING FLOAT

Does only work while playing a sound file, not while recording.

Parameters:
soundId - id used to start the playback
Returns:
the elapsed time

getDurationAudio

FUNCTION getDurationAudio(soundId STRING) RETURNING FLOAT

Returns the duration for a media id, this works only if the file exists and is playable

Parameters:
soundId - id registered with the @see create() function with an existing file name
Returns:
duration of the file

getDurationFromStatus

FUNCTION getDurationFromStatus(mediaStatus util.JSONObject) RETURNING FLOAT

Returns the duration when the status message type is MEDIA_DURATION.

Parameters:
mediaStatus - (pass the return value of getNextStatus())
Returns:
returns a duration out of the given mediaStatus

getErrorFromStatus

FUNCTION getErrorFromStatus(mediaStatus util.JSONObject) RETURNING INT,STRING

Returns the error code and error message when the status message type is MEDIA_ERROR.

Parameters:
mediaStatus - pass the return value of getNextStatus()
Returns:
an error code and an error message

getMediaIdFromStatus

FUNCTION getMediaIdFromStatus(mediaStatus util.JSONObject) RETURNING STRING

Returns the mediaId causing the status event

Parameters:
mediaStatus - (pass the return value of getNextStatus())
Returns:
a mediaId used for recording of playing

getMessageTypeFromStatus

FUNCTION getMessageTypeFromStatus(mediaStatus util.JSONObject) RETURNING INT

Returns a message type out of the given mediaStatus

Parameters:
mediaStatus - (pass the return value of getNextStatus())
Returns:
MEDIA_STATE,MEDIA_DURATION,MEDIA_POSITION or MEDIA_ERROR

getNextStatus

FUNCTION getNextStatus() RETURNING util.JSONObject

Returns the next queued status object and removes it from the internal queue. This object must be passed to the xxFromStatus functions

 WHILE (mediaStatus:=getNextStatus()) IS NOT NULL
   LET messageType=fglcdvMedia.getMessageTypeFromStatus(mediaStatus)
   LET mediaId=fglcdvMedia.getMediaIdFromStatus(mediaStatus)
   CASE messageType
     WHEN fglcdvMedia.MEDIA_STATE
       LET state=fglcdvMedia.getStateFromStatus(mediaStatus)
     WHEN fglcdvMedia.MEDIA_DURATION
       LET duration=fglcdvMedia.getDurationFromStatus(mediaStatus)
     WHEN fglcdvMedia.MEDIA_POSITION
       LET position=fglcdvMedia.getPositionFromStatus(mediaStatus)
     WHEN fglcdvMedia.MEDIA_ERROR
       CALL fglcdvMedia.getErrorFromStatus(mediaStatus) RETURNING code,message
 END WHILE

Returns:
a status object (it can be treated as a kind of opaque handle, you should never access it directly)

getPositionFromStatus

FUNCTION getPositionFromStatus(mediaStatus util.JSONObject) RETURNING FLOAT

Returns the media position out of the given mediaStatus when the status message type is MEDIA_POSITION.

Parameters:
mediaStatus - (pass the return value of getNextStatus())
Returns:
returns a media position out of the given mediaStatus

getRecordingExtensions

FUNCTION getRecordingExtensions() RETURNING DYNAMIC ARRAY OF STRING

Returns an array containing valid file extensions for recording

Returns:
["aac"] for GMA and ["wav","m4a"] for GMI

getStateFromStatus

FUNCTION getStateFromStatus(mediaStatus util.JSONObject) RETURNING INT

Returns the media state when the status message type is MEDIA_STATE.

Parameters:
mediaStatus - (pass the return value of getNextStatus())
Returns:
MEDIA_STATE_NONE,MEDIA_STATE_STARTING,MEDIA_STATE_RUNNING, MEDIA_STATE_PAUSED,MEDIA_STATE_STOPPED

getStatusCount

FUNCTION getStatusCount() RETURNING INT

Returns how many status objects have been queued

Returns:
count of objects

handleCallback

FUNCTION handleCallback()

Handles *all* media events in response to an ON ACTION cordovacallback and queues media status messages internally. Those status messages can be fetched with getNextStatus()

 ON ACTION cordovacallback
   CALL fglcdvMedia.handleCallback()
   WHILE (mediastatus:=fglcdv.getNextStatus()) IS NOT NULL
     --do things with the status objects

init

FUNCTION init()

inits the plugin must be called prior other calls

isValidRecordingExtension

FUNCTION isValidRecordingExtension(extension STRING) RETURNING BOOLEAN

Returns if a a give file extension is a valid extension for recording

Parameters:
extension - extension such as "m4a" or "aac"
Returns:
TRUE if the extension is usable for recording, FALSE otherwise

mediaState2String

FUNCTION mediaState2String(state INTEGER) RETURNING STRING

Returns a string description for a media state.

Parameters:
state - can be one of: MEDIA_STATE_NONE, MEDIA_STATE_STARTING, MEDIA_STATE_RUNNING,MEDIA_STATE_PAUSED, MEDIA_STATE_STOPPED
Returns:
"None", "Starting", "Running", "Paused", Or "Stopped"

messageType2String

FUNCTION messageType2String(messageType INTEGER) RETURNING STRING

Returns a string description for a messageType

Parameters:
messageType - can be one of MEDIA_STATE, MEDIA_DURATION,MEDIA_POSITION,MEDIA_ERROR
Returns:
"MEDIA_STATE", "MEDIA_DURATION", "MEDIA_POSITION", Or "MEDIA_ERROR"

pausePlayingAudio

FUNCTION pausePlayingAudio(soundId STRING)

Pauses playing audio. Causes a cordovacallback about state change. Resume playing with startPlayingAudio (in opposite to resumeRecordingAudio).

Parameters:
soundId - references the sound started with startPlayingAudio

pauseRecordingAudio

FUNCTION pauseRecordingAudio(soundId STRING)

Pauses recording. Resume recording with resumeRecordingAudio(). Causes a cordovacallback about state change.

Parameters:
soundId - id used to start the recording

release

FUNCTION release(soundId STRING)

releases resources associated with a soundId (filename,players,internal recording buffers)

Parameters:
soundId - must have been created before

resumeRecordingAudio

FUNCTION resumeRecordingAudio(soundId STRING)

Resumes recording. Causes a cordovacallback about state change.

Parameters:
soundId - id used to start the recording

seekToAudio

FUNCTION seekToAudio(soundId STRING, position INTEGER)

Seeks to a position in the audio stream. Only available for playback. May causes a cordovacallback about state change.

Parameters:
soundId - id used to start the playback
position - milliseconds since start

setRate

FUNCTION setRate(soundId STRING, rate FLOAT)

Sets the playback rate: only available in IOS.

Parameters:
soundId - id used to start the playback
rate - range 0.0 to 1.0

setVolume

FUNCTION setVolume(soundId STRING, volume FLOAT)

Sets the audio volume.

Parameters:
soundId - id used to start the playback
volume - range 0.0 to 1.0

startPlayingAudio

FUNCTION startPlayingAudio(soundId STRING, playOptions RECORD)

starts playing a sound file if the playback is over, a cordovacallback is triggered the file for playback must have been registered with the create call it must exist and can have several extensions depending on the platform

Parameters:
soundId - registered with the "create" call
playOptions - see playOptionsT

startRecordingAudio

FUNCTION startRecordingAudio(soundId STRING)

Starts recording to file. Possible extensions on IOS: .wav and .mp4 , on Android: .mp3 and .aac . The recording file name was specified using the create() call. In case it exists it will be overwritten. The directory for the file must exist. Causes a cordovacallback about state change.

Parameters:
soundId - unique identfier to reference the recording sound later on

stopPlayingAudio

FUNCTION stopPlayingAudio(soundId STRING)

Stops playing audio. Causes a cordovacallback about state change.

Parameters:
soundId - references the sound started with startPlayingAudio

stopRecordingAudio

FUNCTION stopRecordingAudio(soundId STRING)

Stops recording. Causes a cordovacallback about state change.

Parameters:
soundId - id used to start the recording
